content: centre of these narrowed points once you have got back to the beginning slip_stitch to your 1st st and sew in your ends important read first before stitching around the starting point of stiching around the edge has been specifically chisen to allow for simple stuffing once you have finished sewing your first arm put some stuffing into it once you have stitched around your head stuff it follow this process of stuffing as you go to avoid really awkward angles at the end once you have a little hole left use it to stuff his tummy before closing up and slip_stitch your yarn to your first st try not to overstuff unless this is your specific preference i found he looked better and felt better to be left quite light and bouncy and your fully baked enjoy your gingerbread man 7 www christmas gingerbread man picture 2 left handed crocheter mirror image picture 3 9 www facebook com/elli crochet copyright elli s crochet 2017 christmas gingerbread man note 1 refer to the technical notes and picture 1 to see where to place your hook to begin your first stitch once this is complete the pattern calls for 4 more of these 5 in total the hook must be placed in the base of the stich you may find it simpler to see if you twist your work upside down to see the bottom of this stitch place your hook under both of the strands that are making up the chain of your stitch yarn over pull through yarn over pull through one loop yarn over pull through both loops getting your entry point correct to begin your stitch is the only complicated part of this stitch keep fiddling and you really will get there if you are completely stuck with this method feel free to use a short piece of your yarn and chain a length of 5 chains which you then need to attatch to your work at the place where you would begin the frsc you will then have chains already there for you to crochet into and you will not need to use this method however although it took me a while to master it i have found it useful in certain pieces of work for example if you make a hat from the bottom up this method makes for a far stretchier base and therefore allows a far better fit note 2 i added the safety eyes between row 8 and 9 4-5 st in from either edge with 8 stitches between them see pic 2 eyes can also be embroidered on or beads or buttons used instead thank you so much for making from my pattern please remember you do not have to use my notes they are just there for your use
